image.altText: Golden coins featuring the logos of popular cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin, DOGE and Ethereum

props.synopsis: Scammers have used promises of lucrative investments, romantic relationships, and pleas for assistance to steal $2.5 million from 15 Tasmanians. Police say the victims will suffer life long impacts.

title.children: 15 people lose combined $2.5 million to crypto ATM scams

image.altText: Smoke from wood fuelled heater

props.synopsis: As tourists are urged to come to Tasmania "for air", pollution in Launceston is forcing some locals to leave. Experts say if wood heaters are used properly, it could help improve air quality.Â

title.children: 'Unliveable': Local leaves Tasmanian city amid widespread wood heater use

image.altText: Model of a proposed stadium.

props.synopsis: Amid a state election campaign, Tasmania's Planning Commission has continued assessing the proposed Macquarie Point AFL stadium. Here's what it heard during the past fortnight's hearings.

title.children: What we learnt from the Macquarie Point stadium hearings

props.synopsis: ABC Stateline's Guy Stayner speaks with Tasmanian Labor leader Dean Winter.

title.children: STATELINE: Tasmanian Labor leader Dean Winter talks about his party's plan ahead of the July 19 election

image.altText: Black text hides information in a document

props.synopsis: It took a right to information 'mistake' for the ABC to become aware of concerns about youth in adult prison watch houses. But so much more information remains buried under black ink. Does it have to be this way?

title.children: Accidental release of information a 'good thing', premier says. Should it be the norm?

image.altText: Thumbnail image for Tasmania state election 2025 promise tracker article.

props.synopsis: As Tasmanians prepare for a July 19 vote, we keep track of each party's election promises on everything from health and housing, to the stadium.

title.children: What are Tasmanians being promised at their state election?

image.altText: A man climbs through the window of a moving van.

props.synopsis: A man has been arrested after a dramatic daylight police chase that saw a damaged van swerve through traffic while being pursued along a busy Melbourne freeway.

title.children: Video shows man leaping from moving van during dramatic police chase

image.altText: Matt Rowell celebrates a goal with his teammates

props.synopsis: Gold Coast makes a perfect start against the AFL's ladder-leaders Collingwood in a blockbuster clash at a sold out Carrara Stadium. Follow live.

title.children: Rowell strikes early as Suns make fast start against Magpies

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Touk Miller subbed off with hamstring issue

image.altText: A poster showing three people dressed in Nazi uniforms.

props.synopsis: A man is charged under laws banning the display of Nazi symbols, over a shopfront poster depicting Coalition politicians and mining magnates as German World War II soldiers.

title.children: Man charged over poster depicting politicians and billionaires as Nazis

image.altText: Three man stand around a placid looking lion in a cage.

props.synopsis: Pakistan is cracking down on illegal lion ownership after a pet lion mauled a woman and two children in Lahore.

title.children: Pakistan confiscates 18 pet lions after woman and two children mauled

image.altText: The interior of a restaurant with a twisted timber staircase in the centre.

props.synopsis: Court proceedings reveal how young British men have been recruited for "Russian-backed" arson and kidnap plots in London, as part of Moscow's suspected sabotage campaign across Europe.

title.children: Restaurant kidnap plot raises alarm about growing Russian sabotage

image.altText: Donald Trump and Nick Adams in front of a blue curtain

props.synopsis: A Sydney councillor-turned-MAGA-influencer, who faced suspension from the Liberal Party after swearing at a TV journalist, wins Donald Trump's nomination to become US ambassador to Malaysia.

image.altText: A court sketch of a middle-aged man with short dark hair wearing a suit and tie.

props.synopsis: A drug dealer who fired a shotgun through the front window of a home in suburban Perth, killing an innocent man in his own bedroom, is found guilty of murder.

title.children: Drug dealer convicted of murdering innocent man in bedroom

image.altText: A composite photo featuring US president Donald Trump and a cooked piece of steak.

props.synopsis: Brazilian beef exports to the US would grind to a halt if President Donald Trump enforces a 50 per cent tariff on August 1, opening the gate for more Aussie beef.

title.children: Trump's tariff war with Brazil opens gate for Aussie beef

image.altText: A woman holds a sign that says 'Say no to Plasrefine'

title.children: Community 'outraged' over rejected plastic recycling factory appeal

image.altText: An unidentified teenager stands next to wire fence and checks a phone

props.synopsis: Child victims of domestic violence have told a South Australian royal commission about being beaten, imprisoned in their own homes and made to feel "unloved", but felt ignored when they tried to disclose the abuse. Warning: This story contains content that may distress some readers.

title.children: 'I'm not very loved': Children share domestic violence experiences

image.altText: a man behind the bar of a pub

props.synopsis: Pubs, cafes and restaurants are legally restructuring to wipe their debts and stay open, as the hospitality industry continues to battle tough trading conditions.Â

title.children: Leadership instability at hospital that shuts at 5:30pm, review finds

image.altText: A court sketch of a middle-aged man with short dark hair wearing a suit and tie.

image.altText: Person with flowing fair hair and wide smile stands at beach with arm leaning against brightly coloured block sculpture.
